TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SoapHeader extends System.Object

summary.span: 当在派生类中被重写时，表示 SOAP 标头的内容。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, represents the content of a SOAP header.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果数据与 XML Web service 方法的主要功能无关，则 SOAP 标头提供一种方法，用于将数据传入和向 XML Web service 方法传递数据。SOAP headers offer a method for passing data to and from an XML Web service method if the data is not directly related to the XML Web service method's primary functionality. 例如，XML Web service 可能包含若干 XML Web service 方法，每个方法都需要自定义身份验证方案。For instance, an XML Web service might contain several XML Web service methods that each require a custom authentication scheme. 不是将参数添加到自定义身份验证方案的每个 XML Web service 方法，而是 引用派生自的类， 可应用于每个 XML Web service 方法。Instead of adding parameters to each XML Web service method for the custom authentication scheme, a , referring to a class deriving from , can be applied to each XML Web service method. 派生自的类的实现 处理自定义的身份验证方案。The implementation for the class deriving from handles the custom authentication scheme. 通过这种方式，XML Web service 方法仅实现特定于该方法的功能，并使用 SOAP 标头添加附加功能。In this manner, the XML Web service method implements only the functionality specific to it and adds additional functionality using a SOAP header. 以下列表概述了接收和处理 SOAP 标头的基本步骤：The following list outlines the basic steps to receiving and processing a SOAP header: 1. 创建一个派生自的类，该类 表示传入 SOAP 标头的数据。Create a class that derives from representing the data passed into the SOAP header. 2. 向实现第一步中创建的类型的 XML Web service 或 XML Web service 客户端代理类的类添加成员。Add a member to the class implementing an XML Web service or an XML Web service client proxy class, of the type created in the first step. 3. 将应用 到代理类中的 XML Web service 方法或相应方法，并指定在属性的第二步中创建的成员 。Apply a to the XML Web service method or the corresponding method in the proxy class, specifying the member created in the second step in the property. 4. 在 XML Web service 方法或 XML Web service 客户端代码中，访问 属性来处理 SOAP 标头中发送的数据。Within the XML Web service method or XML Web service client code, access the property to process the data sent in the SOAP header. ## Examples 下面的 `MyWebService` XML Web service 定义 `MyHeader` SOAP 标头，并要求它与对 XML Web service 方法的任何调用一起发送 `MyWebMethod` 。The following `MyWebService` XML Web service defines the `MyHeader` SOAP header and requires it to be sent with any calls to the `MyWebMethod` XML Web service method. 此外，还会 `MyWebMethod` 接收 `MyHeader` soap 标头以外的任何 soap 标头。Additionally, `MyWebMethod` receives any SOAP headers other than the `MyHeader` SOAP header. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic SoapHeader.DidUnderstand Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.DidUnderstand Example/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic SoapHeader.DidUnderstand Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.DidUnderstand Example/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Actor { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Actor : string with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置 SOAP 标头的接收者。

span.span: Gets or sets the recipient of the SOAP header.
The recipient of the SOAP header.
The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要设置 SOAP 标头的接收方，请设置 属性。To set the recipient of a SOAP header, set the property. 无论用于与 XML Web service 进行通信的 SOAP 协议的版本如何，.NET Framework 都会自动生成特定于 SOAP 协议版本的 SOAP 消息。Regardless of the version of the SOAP protocol used to communicate with an XML Web service, the .NET Framework automatically generates the SOAP message specific to the version of the SOAP protocol. 具体而言，这两个版本的表示接收者的 XML 元素和 XML 命名空间不同。Specifically, the XML element and XML namespace representing the recipient differ for the two versions. 接收 SOAP 标头的 XML Web services 可以通过获取或属性来获取目标接收方 。XML Web services receiving the SOAP header can get the intended recipient by getting either the or properties. 对于元素，接收方 (s) `Body` ，soap 消息的元素内的每个 soap 标头都 `Header` 不需要相同。The recipient(s) for the `Body` element and each of the SOAP headers within the `Header` element of a SOAP message need not be the same. 如果 `Header` SOAP 消息中存在元素，则它表示可与 XML Web service 方法或中介一起发送和的附加数据。If a `Header` element exists in the SOAP message, it represents additional data that can be sent to and from the XML Web service method or an intermediary. 在版本1.1 中，该数据的接收方称为 SOAP， `Actor` 可以是与 XML Web service 方法的 uri 不同的 uri。The recipient of that data, known as the SOAP `Actor` in version 1.1, can be a different URI than the URI for the XML Web service method. 有关 SOAP 特性的详细信息 `actor` ，请参阅 [soap](https://www.w3.org/TR/soap/) 规范。For more information on the SOAP `actor` attribute, see the [SOAP](https://www.w3.org/TR/soap/) specification. ## Examples 以下 XML Web service 客户端在 `MyWebMethod` 创建类型的自定义 SOAP 标头 `MyHeader` 并将属性设置为后，将调用 XML Web service 方法 `http://www.contoso.com/MySoapHeaderHandler` 。The following XML Web service client calls the `MyWebMethod` XML Web service method after creating a custom SOAP header of type `MyHeader` and setting the property to `http://www.contoso.com/MySoapHeaderHandler`. [!code-cpp[Classic SoapHeader.Actor Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.Actor Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SoapHeader.Actor Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.Actor Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SoapHeader.Actor Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.Actor Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DidUnderstand { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.DidUnderstand : bool with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示 XML Web services 方法是否已正确处理 SOAP 标头。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an XML Web service method properly processed a SOAP header.

value.span: 如果已正确处理 SOAP 标头，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the SOAP header was properly processed; otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于由 XML Web service 定义的 SOAP 标头，ASP.NET 假定 XML Web service 方法通过将的初始值设置为，正确处理 SOAP 标 头 `true` 。For SOAP headers defined by an XML Web service, ASP.NET assumes the XML Web service method properly processed the SOAP header by setting the initial value of to `true`. 对于 XML Web service 未定义的 SOAP 标头，初始值为 `false` 。For SOAP headers not defined by the XML Web service, the initial value is `false`. 如果 ASP.NET 检测到在方法返回后传递到 XML Web service 方法的 SOAP 标头 ，并将其设置为，则会将返回 `false` 到 XML Web service 客户端，而不是 XML Web service 方法的结果。If ASP.NET detects SOAP headers passed to an XML Web service method with set to `false` after the method returns, a is thrown back to the XML Web service client instead of the results from the XML Web service method. ## Examples 下面的 `MyWebService` XML Web service 定义 `MyHeader` SOAP 标头，并要求它与对 XML Web service 方法的任何调用一起发送 `MyWebMethod` 。The following `MyWebService` XML Web service defines the `MyHeader` SOAP header and requires it to be sent with any calls to the `MyWebMethod` XML Web service method. 此外，还会 `MyWebMethod` 接收 `MyHeader` soap 标头以外的任何 soap 标头。Additionally, the `MyWebMethod` receives any SOAP headers other than the `MyHeader` SOAP header. 对于可以处理的 SOAP 标头 `MyWebMethod` ， 将设置为 `true` 。For SOAP headers that `MyWebMethod` can process, is set to `true`. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic SoapHeader.DidUnderstand Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.DidUnderstand Example/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic SoapHeader.DidUnderstand Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.DidUnderstand Example/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

member this.EncodedMustUnderstand : string with get, set

summary.span: 当与 SOAP 协议 1.1 版通信时，获取或设置 SOAP 标头的 XML 特性值。

span.span: Gets or sets the value of the XML attribute for the SOAP header when communicating with SOAP protocol version 1.1.
The value of the attribute.
The default is "0".

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请勿使用此属性。Do not use this property. 请改用 属性。Instead use the property. ## Examples [!code-cpp[SoapHeader_EncodedMustUnderstand#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapHeader_EncodedMustUnderstand/CPP/soapheader_encodedmustunderstand.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SoapHeader_EncodedMustUnderstand#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapHeader_EncodedMustUnderstand/CS/soapheader_encodedmustunderstand.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SoapHeader_EncodedMustUnderstand#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/SoapHeader_EncodedMustUnderstand/VB/soapheader_encodedmustunderstand.vb#1)]

exception.span: 属性设置为“0”、“1”、“true”或“false”之外的值。

span.span: The property is set to a value other than: "0", "1", "true", or "false".

summary.span: 与 SOAP 协议 1.2 版通信时，获取或设置 SOAP 标头的 XML 属性的值。

span.span: Gets or sets the value of the XML attribute for the SOAP header when communicating with SOAP protocol version 1.2.

value.span: SOAP 标头的 XML 特性的值。

span.span: The value of the XML attribute of a SOAP header.
The default is "0".

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请勿使用此属性。Do not use this property. 请改用 属性。Instead use the property.

exception.span: 属性设置为“0”、“1”、“true”或“false”之外的值。

span.span: The property is set to a value other than: "0", "1", "true", or "false".

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ EncodedRelay { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.EncodedRelay : string with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置 SOAP 1.2 标头的中转特性。

span.span: Gets or sets the relay attribute of the SOAP 1.2 header.
Either "0", "false", "1", or "true".

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此 属性仅适用于 SOAP 1.2，指示消息的接收方在将消息转发到下一个节点时是否转发此标头。The property applies only to SOAP 1.2 and indicates whether the recipient of the message forwards this header when it forwards the message to the next node downstream. 由于 .NET Framework 不支持 SOAP 中介，因此此属性将进行序列化和反序列化，但会被忽略。Because the .NET Framework does not support SOAP intermediaries, this property is serialized and deserialized but ignored.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MustUnderstand { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.MustUnderstand : bool with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否必须理解 。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the must be understood.

value.span: 如果 XML Web services 必须正确解释和处理 ，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the XML Web service must properly interpret and process the ; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当 XML Web service 客户端将 SOAP 标头添加到属性设置为的 XML Web service 方法调用 `true` 中时，XML Web service 方法必须将 属性设置为 `true` ; 否则， ASP.NET 将 XML Web service 引发。When an XML Web service client adds a SOAP header to an XML Web service method call with the property set to `true`, the XML Web service method must set the property to `true`; otherwise, a is thrown back to the XML Web service client by ASP.NET. 尽管 和属性都 可用于在 `mustUnderstand` SOAP 标头中设置属性的值，但 属性允许使用布尔值设置特性。Although both the and properties can be used to set the value of the `mustUnderstand` attribute within the SOAP header, the property allows you to set the attribute using a Boolean value. 有关向客户端添加 SOAP 标头的详细信息，请参阅 [使用 Soap 标头](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/77hkfhh8(v=vs.100))。For details on adding SOAP headers to clients, see [Using SOAP Headers](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/77hkfhh8(v=vs.100)). ## Examples 以下 XML Web service 客户端定义类型的自定义 SOAP 标头 `MyHeader` ，将 属性设置为 `true` ，并调用 `MyWebMethod` XML Web service 方法。The following XML Web service client defines a custom SOAP header of type `MyHeader`, sets the property to `true`, and invokes the `MyWebMethod` XML Web service method. 如果 XML Web service 方法未将 SOAP 标头的属性设置 `MyHeader` 为，则 `true` 会引发。If the XML Web service method does not set the property of the `MyHeader` SOAP header to `true`, a is thrown. [!code-cpp[Classic SoapHeader.MustUnderstand Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.MustUnderstand Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic SoapHeader.MustUnderstand Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.MustUnderstand Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic SoapHeader.MustUnderstand Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic SoapHeader.MustUnderstand Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Relay { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Relay : bool with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示当前节点不理解 SOAP 标头时是否将该标头中转到下一个 SOAP 节点。

span.span: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the SOAP header is to be relayed to the next SOAP node if the current node does not understand the header.

value.span: 如果 SOAP 标头的某个“relay”特性设置为“true”，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the SOAP header has a "relay" attribute set to "true"; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认 SOAP 1.2 处理规则要求 SOAP 节点在将消息传递到下一个节点之前删除 SOAP 处理节点不能理解的标头。The default SOAP 1.2 processing rules require SOAP nodes to remove headers that are not understood by the SOAP processing node before passing the message on to the next node.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Role { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Role : string with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置 SOAP 标头的接收者。

span.span: Gets or sets the recipient of the SOAP header.

value.span: 一个 URI，表示 SOAP 标头的接收者。

span.span: A URI that represents the recipient of the SOAP header.
The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要设置 SOAP 标头的接收方，请设置 属性。To set the recipient of a SOAP header, set the property. 无论用于与 XML Web service 进行通信的 SOAP 协议的版本如何，.NET Framework 都会自动生成特定于 SOAP 协议版本的 SOAP 消息。Regardless of the version of the SOAP protocol used to communicate with an XML Web service, the .NET Framework automatically generates the SOAP message specific to the version of the SOAP protocol. 具体而言，这两个版本的表示接收者的 XML 元素和 XML 命名空间不同。Specifically, the XML element and XML namespace representing the recipient differ for the two versions. 接收 SOAP 标头的 XML Web services 可以通过获取或属性来获取目标接收方 。XML Web services receiving the SOAP header can get the intended recipient by getting either the or properties. 对于元素，接收方 (s) `Body` ，soap 消息的元素内的每个 soap 标头都 `Header` 不需要相同。The recipient(s) for the `Body` element and each of the SOAP headers within the `Header` element of a SOAP message need not be the same. 如果 `Header` SOAP 消息中存在元素，则它表示可与 XML Web service 方法或中介一起发送和的附加数据。If a `Header` element exists in the SOAP message, it represents additional data that can be sent to and from the XML Web service method or an intermediary. 该数据的接收方（ `Role` 在 soap 规范的版本1.2 中称为 soap， `Actor` 版本1.1 中的 soap）可以是与 XML Web service 方法的 uri 不同的 uri。The recipient of that data, known as the SOAP `Role` in version 1.2 of the SOAP specification and the SOAP `Actor` in version 1.1, can be a different URI than the URI for the XML Web service method. 有关 SOAP 特性的详细信息 `actor` ，请参阅 [soap](https://www.w3.org/TR/soap/) 规范。For more information on the SOAP `actor` attribute, see the [SOAP](https://www.w3.org/TR/soap/) specification.
